item.title: Deploying a Static Site with Hugo and GitHub Actions: Zero-Cost Hosting
item.description:
Static sites are the most cost-efficient way to host content. No servers to maintain, no runtime costs, no scaling surprises. With Hugo and GitHub Actions you get a fast, version-controlled blog deployed automatically on every push, for effectively zero cost.

Why Hugo Over Gatsby or Next.js
#

Gatsby had a good run, but the ecosystem has shifted. The project was acquired, maintenance slowed, and most teams that were using it have migrated to Next.js or a static generator. Hugo fills a different niche: it does not care about React, has no Node.js dependency, and builds thousands of pages in under a second. If you are building a blog or documentation site and not a full React application, Hugo is the right tool.

item.title: Creating a Hugo Theme From Scratch: Layouts, Partials, and Template Inheritance
item.description:

Note

This tutorial targets Hugo v0.100+. The layout system changed significantly from older versions. If you are using Hugo before v0.90, expect differences in template lookup rules, configuration syntax, and the way partials are resolved.
